1.verse: The office of John the Baptist. The baptism of Christ, his fasting, his preaching, and the calling of Peter, Andrew, James, and John. Christ heals the man with the unclean spirit, helps Peter’s mother-in-law, and cleanses the leper. The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God,

2.verse: as it is written in the prophets: Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who shall prepare your way before you.

3.verse: The voice of a crier in the wilderness: Prepare ye the way of the Lord; make his paths straight!

4.verse: John baptized in the wilderness, and preached the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.

5.verse: And all the countryside of Judea and the people of Jerusalem went out to him, and were all baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

6.verse: John was clothed with camel’s hair, and with a girdle of skin about his loins. And he ate locusts and wild honey,

7.verse: and preached, saying, One mightier than I comes after me, whose shoe latchet I am not worthy to stoop down and loose.

8.verse: I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.

9.verse: And it came to pass in those days that Jesus came from Nazareth, a town of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan River.

10.verse: And as soon as Jesus came out of the water, John saw heaven open, and the Holy Spirit descending upon him like a dove.

11.verse: And there came a voice from heaven: You are my dear Son, in whom I delight.

12.verse: And immediately the Spirit drove him into the wilderness.

13.verse: And he was there in the wilderness forty days, and was tried by Satan, and was with wild creatures. And the angels ministered to him.

14.verse: After John was taken, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God

15.verse: and saying, The time has come, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent, and believe the gospel!

16.verse: As he walked by the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and John his brother casting nets into the sea, for they were fishermen.

17.verse: And Jesus said to them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.

18.verse: And straightaway they left their nets and followed him.

19.verse: And when he had gone a little further, he saw James the son of Zebedee and John his brother as they were in the boat mending their nets.

20.verse: And right away he called them. And they left their father Zebedee in the boat with his hired servants, and went their way after him.

21.verse: And they entered into Capernaum. And straightaway on the Sabbath days he entered into the synagogue and taught.

22.verse: And the people marvelled at his teaching. For he taught them as one who had power with him, and not as the scribes.

23.verse: And there was in their synagogue a man vexed with an unclean spirit, who cried out,

24.verse: saying, Let us be! What have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know you, who you are: even the Holy One of God.

25.verse: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold your peace and come out of him!

26.verse: And the unclean spirit tore the man and cried out with a loud voice, and came out of him.

27.verse: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned one another among themselves, saying, What thing is this? What new doctrine is this? For he commands the foul spirits with power, and they obey him.

28.verse: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region bordering on Galilee.

29.verse: And directly, as soon as they had left the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew with James and John.

30.verse: And Simon’s mother-in-law lay sick of a fever. And right away they told him of her.

31.verse: And he came and took her by the hand and lifted her up. And the fever left her immediately, and she ministered to them.

32.verse: And in the evening, when the sun was down, people brought to him all their sick and those that were possessed with devils.

33.verse: And all the city gathered together at the door.

34.verse: And he healed many who were sick of different diseases. And he cast out many devils, and would not permit the devils to speak, because they knew him.

35.verse: And in the morning very early, Jesus arose and went out to a solitary place, and there prayed.

36.verse: And Simon and those who were with him followed after Jesus.

37.verse: And when they had found him, they said to him, All the people are searching for you.

38.verse: He said to them, Let us go into the next towns so that I can preach there also; for truly, I came out for that purpose.

39.verse: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast the devils out.

40.verse: And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, who kneeled down to him and said to him, If you will, you can make me clean.

41.verse: And Jesus had compassion on him, and put forth his hand, touched him, and said to him, I will; be clean.

42.verse: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him and he was cleansed.

43.verse: And Jesus charged the man, and sent him away directly,

44.verse: and said to him, See that you say nothing to anyone, but go and show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing those things that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.

45.verse: But the man (as soon as he had left) began to talk freely, and to tell everyone what had been done, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter into the towns, but was out in the country. And people came to him from every quarter.

1.verse: Jesus heals the paralytic, calls Levi, the customs officer, eats with open sinners, and defends his disciples. After a few days he entered into Capernaum again, and it was rumoured that he was in a house.

2.verse: And soon many gathered together, insomuch that now there was no room to receive them, no, not so much as about the door. And he preached the word to them.

3.verse: And there came to him people bringing a paralytic, borne by four men.

4.verse: And because they could not come near to him for the press, they uncovered the roof of the house where he was. And when they had broken it open, they let down the bed that the paralytic lay in.

5.verse: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, Son, your sins are forgiven you.

6.verse: And certain of the scribes were sitting there and thinking in their hearts,

7.verse: How does this fellow so blaspheme? Who can forgive sins, but God only?

8.verse: And immediately, when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so questioned in themselves, he said to them, Why do you think such things in your hearts?

9.verse: Which is easier to say to the paralytic: Your sins are forgiven you, or to say, Arise, take up your bed and walk?

10.verse: But so that you may know that the Son of man has power in earth to forgive sins– He spoke to the paralytic:

11.verse: I say to you, arise, and take up your bed, and go your way into your own house.

12.verse: And at once he arose, took up the bed, and went out before them all, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, We have never seen anything like this!

13.verse: And he went again to the sea side. And all the people gathered to him, and he taught them.

14.verse: And as Jesus was passing by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom and said to him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.

15.verse: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at food in Levi’s house, that many publicans and sinners sat at food also with Jesus and his disciples. For there were many who followed him.

16.verse: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said to his disciples, How is it that he eats and drinks with publicans and sinners?

17.verse: When Jesus heard that, he said to them, The whole have no need of the physician, but the sick do. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

18.verse: And the disciples of John and the Pharisees used to fast, and so they came and said to him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?

19.verse: And Jesus said to them, Can the children of a wedding fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.

20.verse: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast, in those days.

21.verse: Also, no one sows a piece of new cloth onto an old garment, because then the new piece pulls away from the old, and the tear is worse.

22.verse: Likewise, no one pours new wine into old wineskins, for if he does, the new wine bursts the skins, and the wine runs out and the vessels are marred. But new wine must be poured into new vessels.

23.verse: And it chanced that he was walking through the grain fields in the Sabbath days, and his disciples, as they went their way, began to pluck the ears of grain.

24.verse: And the Pharisees said to him, Look, why are they doing on the Sabbath days that which is not lawful?

25.verse: And he said to them, Have you never read what David did when he had need and was hungry, both he and those who were with him?

26.verse: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest and did eat the hallowed loaves, which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests only, and gave also to those who were with him?

27.verse: And he said to them, The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath.

28.verse: Therefore the Son of man is Lord even of the Sabbath day.

1.verse: He helps the man with the withered hand, and chooses his apostles. He casts out the unclean spirit, which the Pharisees ascribe to the devil. The brother, sister, and mother of Christ. And he entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had a withered hand.

2.verse: And they watched him to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath day, so that they might accuse him.

3.verse: And he said to the man who had the withered hand, Arise, and stand in the midst.

4.verse: And he said to them, Is it lawful to do a good deed on the Sabbath days, or an evil deed? To save life, or to kill? But they held their peace.

5.verse: And he looked round about on them angrily, mourning the blindness of their hearts, and said to the man, Stretch forth your hand. And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored fully as whole as the other.

6.verse: Then the Pharisees departed, and straightaway assembled a council with Herod’s men against him, so that they might destroy him.

7.verse: And Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the sea. And great crowds followed him from Galilee and from Judea,

8.verse: and from Jerusalem and from Idumea and from beyond the Jordan, and also those who dwelt about Tyre and Sidon: great crowds who, when they heard the things he did, came to him.

9.verse: And he told his disciples that a boat should be kept at hand for him, because of the people, lest they should throng him.

10.verse: For he had healed many, insomuch that they pressed in upon him to touch him, as many as had afflictions.

11.verse: And when the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, saying, You are the Son of God!

12.verse: And he charged them strictly not to make him known.

13.verse: And he went up into a mountain and called to him whom he wished, and they came to him.

14.verse: And he ordained the twelve to be with him, so that he might send them to preach,

15.verse: and to have power to heal sicknesses and to cast out devils.

16.verse: And he gave Simon the name Peter.

17.verse: And he called James, the son of Zebedee, and John, James’ brother, and gave them the name Boanerges, which means Sons of Thunder.

18.verse: And there were Andrew and Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon of Canaan,

19.verse: and Judas Iscariot, which same also betrayed him. And they came to a house.

20.verse: And the people assembled together again, so greatly that they had no opportunity so much as to eat bread.

21.verse: And when his family members heard of it, they set out to get him, because they thought he would be beside himself.

22.verse: And the scribes who came from Jerusalem said, He has Beelzebub, and by the power of the chief devil he casts out devils.

23.verse: And Jesus called them to him and spoke to them in similitudes: How can Satan drive out Satan?

24.verse: For if a realm is divided against itself, that realm cannot endure.

25.verse: Or if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot continue.

26.verse: So if Satan makes insurrection against himself and is divided, he cannot continue, but is at an end.

27.verse: No one can enter into a strong man’s house and take away his goods unless he first binds the strong man, and then he plunders his house.

28.verse: Truly I say to you, all sins may be forgiven the children of men, and blasphemies with which they blaspheme.

29.verse: But he who blasphemes the Holy Spirit may never have forgiveness, but is liable to eternal condemnation.

30.verse: (For they said he had an unclean spirit.)

31.verse: Then his mother and his brethren arrived and stood outside, and sent to him and called for him.

32.verse: The people were sitting around him, and they said to Jesus, Your mother and your brethren are asking for you outside.

33.verse: And he answered them, saying, Who are my mother and my brethren?

34.verse: And he looked round about on his disciples, who sat in a circle around him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren.

35.verse: For whosoever does the will of God, he is my brother, my sister, and mother.

1.verse: The parable of the sower. Take heed to God’s word. Christ stills the tempest of the sea, which obeyed him. And he began again to teach by the sea side. And there gathered together unto him crowds of people, so greatly that he entered into the boat and sat in it in the sea, and all the people were by the sea side on the shore.

2.verse: And he taught them many things in similitudes, and said to them in his lesson:

3.verse: Hearken to! Behold, there went out a sower to sow.

4.verse: And it happened as he sowed that some seed fell by the wayside, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

5.verse: Some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth, and quickly sprang up because it did not have depth of earth;

6.verse: but as soon as the sun was up, it caught heat, and because it did not have rooting, withered away.

7.verse: And some fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, so that it gave no fruit.

8.verse: And some fell upon good ground, and yielded fruit that sprang up and grew, and brought forth: some thirtyfold, some sixtyfold, and some a hundredfold.

9.verse: And he said to them, He who has ears to hear, let him hear.

10.verse: And when he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the similitude.

11.verse: And he said to them, To you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God. But to those who are outside, all things shall be done in similitudes,

12.verse: and when they see, they will see but not discern, and when they hear, they will hear and not understand, lest at any time they should turn; and their sins would be forgiven them.

13.verse: And he said to them, Do you not understand this similitude? How then will you understand any other similitudes?

15.verse: And those who are by the wayside where the word is sown are those to whom, as soon as they have heard it, Satan comes immediately, and takes away the word that was sown in their hearts.

16.verse: And likewise, those who receive the seed on the stony ground are those who, when they have heard the word, at once receive it with gladness,

17.verse: yet have no roots in themselves. And so they endure but a time, and once trouble and persecution arise for the word’s sake, they fall immediately.

18.verse: And those who receive the seed among the thorns are such as hear the word,

19.verse: but the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the hunger for other things, enter in and choke the word, and it is made unfruitful.

20.verse: And those who received the seed in good ground are those who hear the word and receive it, and bring forth fruit: some thirtyfold, some sixtyfold, some a hundredfold.

21.verse: And Jesus said to the people, Is the candle lighted to be put under a bushel or under the table, and not rather to be put on a candlestick?

22.verse: For there is nothing so hid that it will not be revealed, nor so secret but that it may become clear.

23.verse: If any person has ears to hear, let him hear.

24.verse: And he said to them, Attend with care to what you hear. With the same measure you give, it will be measured back to you. And to you who hear, more will be given.

25.verse: For to him who has, it will be given, but from him who has not shall be taken away even what he has.

26.verse: And he said, The kingdom of God is like this: it is as if a man sows seed in the ground,

27.verse: and sleeps, and rises up night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows up, he knows not how.

28.verse: For the earth brings forth fruit of herself: first the blade, then the ears, after that the full grain in the ears.

29.verse: And as soon as the fruit is brought forth, immediately the man thrusts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.

30.verse: And he said, To what may we liken the kingdom of God? or what comparison can we use?

31.verse: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is the least of all seeds that are in the earth.

32.verse: But after it is sown, it grows up and is greatest of all shrubs, and bears great branches, so that the birds of the air may dwell under the cover of it.

33.verse: And with many such similitudes he preached the word to the people, as they were able to hear it.

34.verse: And without similitude he spoke nothing to them. But when they were apart, he expounded all things to his disciples.

35.verse: And the same day, when evening was come, he said to them, Let us pass over to the other side.

36.verse: And they left the people and took him just as he was in the boat. And there were also with him other boats.

37.verse: And there arose a great storm of wind, and it dashed the waves into the boat so that it was full.

38.verse: And he was in the stern, asleep on a pillow. And they awoke him and said to him, Teacher, do you not care if we perish?

39.verse: And he rose up and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, Peace, and be still! And the wind allayed, and there followed a great calm.

40.verse: And he said to them, Why are you so fearful? How is it that you have no faith?

41.verse: And they feared exceedingly and said to one another, What manner of man is this? For both wind and sea obey him.

1.verse: He delivers the possessed man from the unclean spirits, and the woman from the flow of blood, and raises the synagogue leader’s daughter. And they went over to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

2.verse: And when he got out of the boat, there met him out of the graves a man possessed by an unclean spirit,

3.verse: who had his dwelling among the graves. And no man could bind him, no, not with chains.

4.verse: For he had often been bound with shackles and chains, but he pulled the chains apart and broke the shackles in pieces. Neither could anyone quiet him.

5.verse: And always, both night and day, he wailed in the mountains and in the graves, and beat himself with stones.

6.verse: When he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and knelt before him,

7.verse: and cried out with a loud voice and said, What have I to do with you, Jesus Son of the most high God? I call on you in the name of God not to torment me.

8.verse: For Jesus had said to him, Come out of the man, you foul spirit!

9.verse: And Jesus asked him, What is your name? He answered, saying, My name is Legion, for we are many.

10.verse: And he pressed Jesus urgently not to send them away out of the region.

11.verse: And there was there, near to the mountains, a great herd of swine feeding.

12.verse: All the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the herd of swine, so that we may enter into them.

13.verse: And at once Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out and entered into the swine. And the herd started, and ran headlong into the sea. There were about 2,000 swine, and they were drowned in the sea.

14.verse: And the swineherds fled and told this in the town and in the country. And the people came out to see what had happened,

15.verse: and came to Jesus. They saw the man who had been vexed with the fiend and had the legion sitting both clothed and in his right mind, and were afraid.

16.verse: And those who had seen it told them what had happened to the man possessed with the devil, and also about the swine.

17.verse: And they began to urge Jesus to depart from their shores.

18.verse: And when he got into the boat, the man who had been possessed with the devil asked him if he could be with him.

19.verse: However Jesus would not allow him, but said to him, Go home to your own house and to your friends, and show them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had compassion on you.

20.verse: And he departed and began to tell everywhere in the Ten Cities what great things Jesus had done for him. And all the people marvelled.

21.verse: And when Jesus had crossed over again by boat to the other side, crowds of people gathered to him. And he was near to the sea.

22.verse: And there came one of the leaders of the synagogue, whose name was Jairus. And when he saw him, he fell down at his feet,

23.verse: and besought him greatly, saying, My daughter lies at the point of death. Please come and lay your hand on her, so that she can be saved and live.

24.verse: And Jesus went with him, and the crowds followed him and thronged him.

25.verse: And there was a certain woman who had been troubled by a flow of blood for twelve years.

26.verse: She had endured many things from many physicians, and spent all that she had, and was not helped at all, but grew worse and worse.

27.verse: When she heard of Jesus, she penetrated the press behind him and touched his garment.

28.verse: For she thought, If I can but touch his clothes, I shall be healed.

29.verse: And straightaway her flow of blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of the illness.

30.verse: And Jesus immediately felt in himself the power that went out of him, and turned around in the press of people and said, Who touched my clothes?

31.verse: And his disciples said to him, You see the people thronging you, and yet you ask, Who touched me?

32.verse: And he looked round about to see who had done it.

33.verse: The woman feared and trembled (for she knew what was done within her), and she came and fell down before him, and told him the truth of everything.

34.verse: And he said to her, Daughter, your faith has made you whole. Go in peace, and be healed of your affliction.

35.verse: While he was yet speaking, certain people came from the house of the synagogue leader and said, Your daughter is dead; why trouble the Teacher any further?

36.verse: As soon as Jesus heard that word spoken, he said to the leader of the synagogue, Be not afraid; only believe.

37.verse: And he let no one follow him other than Peter, James, and John the brother of James.

38.verse: And he went to the house of the synagogue leader and saw the disturbance, and the people who wept and wailed greatly,

39.verse: and went in and said to them, Why do you make this ado, and weep? The maiden is not dead, but sleeping.

40.verse: And they laughed him to scorn. Then he put them all out, and took the father and the mother of the maiden and those who were with him, and entered in where the maiden lay.

41.verse: He took the maiden by the hand and said to her, Tabitha, cumi! which translated is, Child, I say to you, arise.

42.verse: And at once the maiden arose, and she walked on her feet, for she was twelve years of age. And they were astonished at it beyond measure.

43.verse: And he charged them strictly that no one should know of it, and said to give her food.

1.verse: Christ sends his apostles to heal people who were diseased. Of John and Herod. Of the five loaves and two fishes, and of the walking on the sea. And he departed from there and went into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

2.verse: And when the Sabbath day came, he began to teach in the synagogue. And many who heard him were astonished and said, Where does he have these things from? And what wisdom is this that is given to him? And such miracles that are wrought by his hands!

3.verse: Is this not that carpenter – Mary’s son, the brother of James and Joses, and of Judas and Simon? And are his sisters not here with us? And they were offended by him.

4.verse: And Jesus said to them, A prophet is not without honour but in his own country, and among his own kin, and among those who are of the same household.

5.verse: And he could show no miracles there, except he laid his hands upon a few sick folk and healed them.

6.verse: And he marvelled at their unbelief. And he went about by the towns that lay on every side, teaching.

7.verse: And he called the twelve and began to send them out two by two, and gave them power over unclean spirits.

8.verse: And he commanded them to take nothing for their journey save only a rod – no bag, no bread, no money in their belts –

9.verse: but to be shod with sandals, and not to put on two coats.

10.verse: And he said to them, Wherever you enter into a house, stay there till you move on from that town.

11.verse: And whoever does not receive you or hear you, when you leave there, shake off the dust that is under your feet, for a witness to them. I say truly to you, it will be easier for Sodom and Gomorrah at the day of judgment than for that place.

12.verse: And they went out and preached that the people should repent.

13.verse: And they cast out many devils, and anointed many who were sick with oil, and healed them.

14.verse: And King Herod heard of Jesus (for his name was spread abroad) and said, John the Baptist has risen again from death, and therefore  miracles are wrought by him.

15.verse: Others said, It is Elijah; and some said, It is a prophet, or like one of the prophets.

16.verse: But when Herod heard of him, he said, It is John whom I beheaded: he has risen back up from death.

17.verse: For Herod himself had sent forth and seized John, and bound him and cast him into prison for the sake of Herodias, who was his brother Philip’s wife. For Herod had married her.

18.verse: John said to Herod, It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.

19.verse: So Herodias was laying in wait for him, and would have killed him. But she could not,

20.verse: because Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just and holy man, and gave him reverence. And he heeded him in many things, and heard him gladly.

21.verse: But when an opportune day came, Herod on his birthday put on a supper for the lords, captains, and chief personages of Galilee.

22.verse: And the daughter of the said Herodias came in and danced, and pleased Herod and those who sat with him. Then the king said to the maiden, Ask of me what you will, and I will give it to you.

23.verse: And he swore to her, Whatever you ask of me, I will give it to you, even up to one half of my kingdom.

24.verse: And she went out and said to her mother, What should I ask for? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.

25.verse: And the maiden went in straightaway with haste to the king and asked, saying, I would like you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.

26.verse: And the king was sorry. However, for his oath’s sake, and because of those who sat at supper also, he did not want to put her beside her purpose.

27.verse: And immediately the king sent the hangman and commanded John’s head to be brought in. And he went and beheaded him in the prison,

28.verse: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the maiden, and the maiden gave it to her mother.

29.verse: And when John’s disciples heard of it, they came and took up his body, and put it in a tomb.

30.verse: And the apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done and what they had taught.

31.verse: And he said to them, Come apart into the countryside and rest awhile. For there were so many comers and goers that they had no time so much as to eat.

32.verse: And they went by boat out of the way into an isolated place.

33.verse: But the people noticed them when they departed, and many recognized him. And they ran there by foot out of all the towns, and got there before them, and came together to him.

34.verse: And Jesus went out and saw the crowds of people, and had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. And he began to teach them many things.

35.verse: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came to him, saying, This is an isolated place, and now the day is far gone.

36.verse: Let the people depart so that they can go into the country round about and into the towns and buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.

37.verse: He answered and said to them, You give them to eat. And they said to him, Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them to eat?

38.verse: He said to them, How many loaves do you have? Go and look. And when they had searched, they said, Five, and two fishes.

39.verse: And Jesus directed them to make all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.

40.verse: And they sat down here a row and there a row, by hundreds and by fifties.

41.verse: And he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looked up to heaven, and blessed, and broke the loaves, and gave them to his disciples to put before the people. And he divided the two fishes among them all.

42.verse: And they all did eat and were satisfied.

43.verse: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments and of the fishes.

44.verse: And those who ate were about 5,000 men.

45.verse: And straightaway he made his disciples get into the boat and go ahead over the water to Bethsaida while he sent the people away.

46.verse: And as soon as he had sent them away, he went apart to a mountain to pray.

47.verse: And when evening was come, the boat was in the middle of the sea and he was alone on the land.

48.verse: And he saw them having trouble rowing, for the wind was contrary to them. And about the fourth quarter of the night he went out to them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.

49.verse: When they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it was a spirit and cried out.

50.verse: For they all saw him and were afraid. And immediately he spoke to them and said to them, Be of good cheer, it is I. Be not afraid.

51.verse: And he went up to them into the boat, and the wind ceased; and they were greatly amazed in themselves beyond measure, and taken aback.

52.verse: For they did not remember about the loaves, because their hearts were blinded.

53.verse: And they crossed over and went into the land of Gennesaret, and drew up to anchorage.

54.verse: And as soon as they got out of the boat, people quickly recognized Jesus,

55.verse: and ran everywhere throughout all the region round about, and began to carry all who were sick in beds to the place where they heard he was.

56.verse: And wherever he entered into towns, cities, or villages, they laid their sick in the streets and begged to touch even just the edge of his vesture. And as many as touched him were made well.

1.verse: The disciples eat with unwashed hands. The commandment of God is transgressed by man’s precepts. Of the woman of Syro-Phoenicia. Of the Sabbath. And the Pharisees came together to him, and some of the scribes who came from Jerusalem.

2.verse: And when they saw certain of his disciples eat bread with common hands (that is to say, with unwashed hands), they complained.

3.verse: For the Pharisees and all the Jews, unless they wash their hands often, will not eat, observing the precepts of the elders.

4.verse: And when they come from the market, unless they wash, they will not eat. And there are many other things that they have taken upon themselves to observe, such as the washing of cups and pitchers, and of copper pots, and of tables.

5.verse: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why do your disciples not walk according to the precepts of the elders, but eat bread with unwashed hands?

6.verse: He answered and said to them, Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written: This people honours me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

7.verse: In vain they worship me, teaching doctrines which are nothing but the commandments of men.

8.verse: For you lay the commandment of God aside, and observe the precepts of men, such as the washing of pitchers and of cups. And many other suchlike things you do.

9.verse: And he said to them, All too well do you cast aside the commandment of God to maintain your own precepts.

10.verse: For Moses said, Honour your father and your mother, and whosoever curses father or mother, let him die for it.

11.verse: But you say a man should say to father or mother, Corban, which is, What you ask me for, to help you with, is dedicated to God.

12.verse: And so you no longer let him do anything for his father or his mother,

13.verse: making the word of God of no effect through your own precepts, which you have established. And many such things you do.

14.verse: And he called all the people to him and said to them, Hearken unto me, every one of you, and understand.

15.verse: There is nothing outside a man that can defile him when it enters into him. But those things that proceed out of him are the things that defile a man.

16.verse: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.

17.verse: And when he went indoors, away from the people, his disciples asked him about the similitude.

18.verse: And he said to them, Are you also without understanding? Do you not yet perceive that whatever thing from without enters into a person, it cannot defile him,

19.verse: because it enters not into his heart, but into the stomach, and goes out into the drain that carries away all foods?

20.verse: And he said, What defiles a man is that which comes out of a man.

21.verse: For from within, namely out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts: adultery, fornication, murder,

22.verse: theft, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, uncleanness, a wicked eye, slander, pride, foolishness.

23.verse: All these evil things come from within, and defile a person.

24.verse: From there he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into a house, and wanted no one to know. But he could not be hid.

25.verse: For a certain woman whose daughter had a foul spirit heard of him, and came and fell at his feet.

26.verse: The woman was a Greek out of Syro-Phoenicia, and she besought him to cast the devil out of her daughter.

27.verse: And Jesus said to her, Let the children first be fed. For it is not meet to take the children’s bread and cast it to dogs.

28.verse: She answered and said to him, Quite so, Master. Nevertheless, the dogs also eat under the table of the children’s crumbs.

29.verse: And he said to her, For this saying, go your way; the devil has gone out of your daughter.

30.verse: And when she arrived home, she found the devil departed, and her daughter lying on the bed.

31.verse: And he departed again from the region of Tyre and Sidon, and went to the Sea of Galilee through the region of the Ten Cities.

32.verse: And some people brought to him a man who was deaf and stammered in his speech, and asked him to put his hand upon him.

33.verse: And he took him aside from the people, and put his fingers in his ears, and spat, and touched his tongue,

34.verse: and looked up to heaven and sighed, and said to him, Ephatha; that is to say, Be opened.

35.verse: And straightaway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke plainly.

36.verse: And Jesus directed them to tell no one. But the more he forbad them, so much the more greatly they spoke of it.

37.verse: And they were beyond measure astonished, saying, He has done all things well, and has made both the deaf to hear and the dumb to speak.

1.verse: The miracle of the seven loaves. The Pharisees ask for a sign. The leaven of the Pharisees and of Herod. The blind man receives his sight. In the days when there was a great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said to them,

2.verse: I have compassion on this people, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat.

3.verse: And if I send them away to their own houses without eating, they might faint on the way, because some of them have come from far.

4.verse: And his disciples answered him, Where could anyone obtain bread here in this remote place to satisfy all these?

5.verse: And he asked them, How many loaves do you have? They said, Seven.

6.verse: And he directed the people to sit down on the ground. And he took the seven loaves, gave thanks, broke, and gave to his disciples to set before them. And they set them before the people.

7.verse: And they had a few small fishes, and he blessed them, and directed them also to be set before the people.

8.verse: And they ate and were filled. And they took up of the broken food that was left seven baskets full.

9.verse: And those who had eaten were in number about 4,000. And Jesus sent them away.

10.verse: And shortly he entered into a boat with his disciples, and went into the region of Dalmanutha.

11.verse: And the Pharisees came out and began to dispute with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, and testing him.

12.verse: And he sighed in his spirit and said, Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly I say to you, there will be no sign given to this generation.

13.verse: And he left them and went into the boat again, and departed over the water.

14.verse: And the disciples had forgotten to take bread with them, and had in the boat with them no more than one loaf.

15.verse: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod.

16.verse: And they deliberated among themselves, saying, It is because we have no bread.

17.verse: And when Jesus knew this, he said to them, Why are you troubled because you have no bread? Do you not yet perceive or understand? Are your hearts still blinded?

18.verse: Do you have eyes, but not see? And do you have ears, and not hear? Do you not remember?

19.verse: When I broke five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up? They said to him, Twelve.

20.verse: When I broke seven among four thousand, how many baskets of the leftover fragments did you take up? They said, Seven.

21.verse: And he said to them, How is it that you do not understand?

22.verse: And he came to Bethsaida, and people brought a blind man to him and asked him to touch him.

23.verse: And he took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the town, and spat in his eyes, and put his hands upon him, and asked him whether he could see anything.

24.verse: And the man looked up and said, I see the people, for I see them walk, as if they were trees.

25.verse: After that Jesus put his hands again upon his eyes, and made him see. And his sight was restored, and he saw every person clearly.

26.verse: And Jesus sent him home to his house, saying, Do not go into the town, nor tell anyone in town about this.

27.verse: And Jesus went out with his disciples into the towns around the city called Caesarea Philippi. And on the way he asked his disciples, saying, Who do people say that I am?

28.verse: And they answered, Some say that you are John the Baptist, some say Elijah, and some, one of the prophets.

29.verse: And he said to them, But who do you say that I am? Peter answered and said to him, You are the Christ.

30.verse: And he charged them to tell no one of it.

31.verse: And he began to teach them how the Son of man must suffer many things, and would be reproved by the elders and by the high priests and scribes, and be killed, and after three days arise again.

32.verse: And he spoke this word plainly. But Peter took him aside and began to chide him.

33.verse: Then he turned around and looked on his disciples, and rebuked Peter, saying, Get behind me, Satan, for you savour not the things of God, but the things of men.

34.verse: And he called the people to him with his disciples also, and said to them, Whoever would follow me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross and follow me.

35.verse: For whoever would save his life, will lose it. But whoever loses his life for my sake and the sake of the gospel, shall save it.

36.verse: What does it profit a man, if he should win all the world and lose his own soul?

37.verse: Or what can a person give to redeem his soul?

38.verse: Whosoever therefore is ashamed of me and of my words among this adulterous and sinful generation, of him will the Son of man be ashamed when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.

1.verse: And he said to them, Truly I say to you, there are some standing here who will not taste of death till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.

2.verse: The transfiguration. The frenzied boy is healed. Who should be the greatest. Offences are forbidden. And after six days, Jesus took Peter, James, and John, and led them up into a high mountain out of the way alone. And he was transfigured before them.

3.verse: And his raiment did shine, and was made very white, even as snow: such a white as no fuller can make upon the earth.

4.verse: And there appeared to them Elijah with Moses, and they talked with Jesus.

5.verse: And Peter spoke and said to Jesus, Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three tabernacles: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.

6.verse: And yet he did not know what he was saying, for they were afraid.

7.verse: And there was a cloud that covered them. And a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my dear Son; hear him!

8.verse: And suddenly, when they looked round about them, they saw no one but Jesus with them.

9.verse: And as they came down from the hill, he charged them to tell no one what they had seen until the Son of man was risen from death again.

10.verse: And they kept that saying with them, and wondered amongst themselves what rising from death again might mean.

11.verse: And they asked him, saying, Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?

12.verse: He answered and said to them, Indeed, Elijah does first come, and restore all things. And also the Son of man, as it is written, will suffer many things, and will be rejected.

13.verse: Moreover I say to you that Elijah has come, and they have done to him whatsoever pleased them, as it is written of him.

14.verse: And he came to his disciples and saw crowds of people about them, and the scribes disputing with them.

15.verse: And straightaway all the people, when they saw Jesus, were moved with wonder, and ran to him and greeted him.

16.verse: And he said to the scribes, What are you disputing with them?

17.verse: A man from the crowd answered and said, Teacher, I have brought my son to you, who has a dumb spirit,

18.verse: and whenever it takes him, it tears him, and he foams and gnashes with his teeth, and collapses. And I spoke to your disciples, to cast it out, but they could not.

19.verse: Jesus answered him and said, O generation without faith, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I suffer you? Bring him to me.

20.verse: And they brought the boy to him. And as soon as the spirit saw him, it tore the boy, and he fell down on the ground, wallowing and foaming.

21.verse: And Jesus asked his father, How long has this been happening to him? And he said, Since childhood.

22.verse: And often it casts him into the fire, and also into the water, to kill him. But if you can do anything, have mercy on us and help us!

23.verse: And Jesus said to him, If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.

24.verse: And straightaway the father of the child exclaimed with tears, saying, Lord, I believe; help my unbelief!

25.verse: When Jesus saw that the people came running to gather to him, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying to him, Deaf and dumb spirit, I charge you to come out of him, and enter no more into him!

26.verse: And the spirit cried out, and rent him badly, and came out. And the boy was as one dead, insomuch that many said, He is dead.

27.verse: But Jesus caught his hand and lifted him up, and he arose.

28.verse: And when Jesus had entered into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could we not cast him out?

29.verse: And he said to them, This kind can come out no other way but by prayer and fasting.

30.verse: And they left that place, and took their journey through Galilee. But Jesus did not want anyone to know of it,

31.verse: because he was teaching his disciples. And he said to them, The Son of man will be delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill him. And after he has been killed, he will arise again on the third day.

32.verse: But they did not comprehend what that saying meant, and were afraid to ask him.

33.verse: And they came to Capernaum. And once he was indoors, he asked them, What was it that you were disputing between yourselves along the way?

34.verse: And they held their peace, for on the road they had been debating among themselves who should be chief.

35.verse: And he sat down and called the twelve to him and said to them, If any man desires to be first, let him be last of all, and servant to all.

36.verse: And he took a child and set him in the midst of them, and took him in his arms and said to them,

37.verse: Whosoever receives any such a child in my name, receives me. And whosoever receives me, receives not me, but him who sent me.

38.verse: John answered him, saying, Teacher, we saw someone who does not follow us casting out devils in your name, and we told him not to, because he does not follow us.

39.verse: But Jesus said, Do not forbid him. For no one who does a miracle in my name can lightly speak evil of me.

40.verse: Whosoever is not against you, is on your side.

41.verse: And whosoever gives you a cup of water to drink for my name’s sake, because you belong to Christ, truly I say to you, he will not lose his reward.

42.verse: But whoever hurts one of these little ones that believe in me, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were cast into the sea.

43.verse: Therefore if your hand causes you to offend, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed than, having two hands, to go into hell, into fire that never shall be quenched,

44.verse: where their worm dies not and the fire never goes out.

45.verse: Likewise, if your foot causes you to offend, cut it off. For it is better for you to go lame into life than, having two feet, to be cast into hell, into fire that never shall be quenched,

46.verse: where their worm dies not and the fire never goes out.

47.verse: So also if your eye causes you to offend, tear it out. It is better for you to go into the kingdom of God with one eye than, having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire,

48.verse: where their worm dies not and the fire never goes out.

49.verse: Every man therefore must be salted with fire. And every sacrifice must be seasoned with salt.

50.verse: Salt is good. But if the salt is unsavoury, what can you salt with it? See that you have salt in yourselves. And have peace among yourselves, one with another.

1.verse: On divorce. The rich man questions Christ. Of the sons of Zebedee. Bartimaeus the blind man. And he arose from there and went into the borders of Judea, through the region that is beyond the Jordan. And the people resorted to him afresh, and as his custom was, he taught them again.

2.verse: And the Pharisees came and asked him a question, whether it was lawful for a man to put away his wife, in order to prove him.

3.verse: And he answered and said to them, What did Moses tell you to do?

4.verse: And they said, Moses permitted us to write a testimonial of divorce and to put her away.

5.verse: And Jesus answered and said to them, For the hardness of your hearts he wrote this precept for you.

6.verse: But at the first creation, God made them man and woman.

7.verse: And for the sake of this, a man must leave his father and mother and abide by his wife,

8.verse: and the two shall be one flesh. So then they are now not two, but are one flesh.

9.verse: Therefore what God has joined together, let not man separate.

10.verse: And in the house, his disciples asked him again about that matter.

11.verse: And he said to them, Whoever puts away his wife and marries another, breaks wedlock to her.

12.verse: And if a woman forsakes her husband and is married to another, she commits adultery.

13.verse: And they brought children to him, for him to touch them. And his disciples rebuked the people who brought them.

14.verse: When Jesus saw that, he was displeased, and said to them, Suffer the children to come to me, and forbid them not. For of such is the kingdom of God.

15.verse: Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child, he shall not enter therein.

16.verse: And he took them up in his arms, and put his hands upon them, and blessed them.

17.verse: And when he had gone out to the road, a man came running, and kneeled to him and asked him, Good Teacher, what should I do so that I may inherit eternal life?

18.verse: Jesus said to him, Why do you call me good? There is none good but one, who is God.

19.verse: You know the commandments: do not break matrimony, do not kill, do not steal, bear no false witness, defraud no man, honour your father and mother.

20.verse: He answered and said to him, Teacher, all these I have observed from my youth.

21.verse: Jesus regarded him with favour and said to him, One thing is lacking to you. Go and sell all that you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. And come and follow me, and take up the cross.

22.verse: But the man was downcast with that saying, and went away grieved, for he had great possessions.

23.verse: And Jesus looked round about and said to his disciples, What a hard thing it is for those who have riches to enter into the kingdom of God.

24.verse: And his disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus spoke again and said to them, Children, how hard is it for those who trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God?

25.verse: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

26.verse: And they were astonished out of measure, saying between themselves, Who then can be saved?

27.verse: Jesus looked upon them and said, With men it is impossible, but not with God. For with God, all things are possible.

28.verse: And Peter began to say to him, Lo, we have left everything and have followed you.

29.verse: Jesus answered and said, Truly I say to you, there is no one who gives up house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake and the gospel’s,

30.verse: who will not receive a hundredfold now in this life: houses and brethren and sisters and mothers and children and lands – with persecutions – and in the world to come, eternal life.

31.verse: But many that are first will be last, and the last, first.

32.verse: And they were on the road going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus went before them. And they were amazed, and as they followed, were afraid. And Jesus took the twelve again, and began to tell them the things that would happen to him:

33.verse: Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of man will be delivered to the high priests and to the scribes. And they will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.

34.verse: And they will mock him, and scourge him, and spit upon him, and kill him. And the third day he will rise again.

35.verse: And then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him, saying, Teacher, we would like you to do for us whatever we ask.

36.verse: He said to them, What would you like me to do for you?

37.verse: They said to him, Grant to us that we may sit one on your right hand, and the other on your left hand, in your glory.

38.verse: But Jesus said to them, You know not what you ask. Can you drink of the cup that I must drink of, and be baptized in the baptism that I must be baptized in?

39.verse: And they said to him, That we can. Jesus said to them, You will drink of the cup that I will drink of, and be baptized with the baptism that I will be baptized in.

40.verse: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give, but is for them for whom it is prepared.

41.verse: And when the ten heard this, they began to be much displeased with James and John.

42.verse: But Jesus called them to him and said to them, You know that those who are seen to bear rule among the Gentiles reign as lords over them. And those who are great among them exercise authority over them.

43.verse: It shall not be this way among you, but whoever would be great among you shall minister to you,

44.verse: and whoever would be chief shall be servant to all.

45.verse: For even the Son of man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life for the redemption of many.

46.verse: And they came to Jericho. And as he was going out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, Bartimaeus the son of Timeus, who was blind, sat by the side of the high road, begging.

47.verse: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to call out and to say, Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!

48.verse: And many people admonished him to hold his peace. But he cried the more a great deal, Son of David, have mercy on me!

49.verse: And Jesus stood still and directed that he be called. And they called the blind man, saying to him, Be of good comfort. Rise, he has called you.

50.verse: And he threw away his cloak, and rose and came to Jesus.

51.verse: And Jesus spoke and said to him, What do you want me to do for you? The blind man said to him, Teacher, that I could see!

52.verse: Jesus said to him, Go your way; your faith has saved you. And immediately the man received his sight, and followed Jesus in the road.

1.verse: Christ rides into Jerusalem. The fig tree dries up. The buyers and sellers are cast out of the temple. The Pharisees question Christ. And when they came near Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany beside the Mount of Olives, he sent forth two of his disciples

2.verse: and said to them, Go your ways into the town that is in front of you. And as soon as you have entered into it, you will find a colt tied, on which no man ever sat. Untie him and bring him here.

3.verse: And if anyone asks you why you are doing this, say that the Lord has need of him, and straightaway he will send him here.

4.verse: And they went their way and found a colt tied by the door outside, in a place where two roads met, and they untied him.

5.verse: And some of the people standing there said to them, What are you doing, untying the colt?

6.verse: And they answered just as Jesus had instructed, and the people let them go.

7.verse: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on it, and he sat upon it.

8.verse: And many spread their garments in the way. Others cut down branches of the trees and strew them in the way.

9.verse: And those who went before, and those who followed, cried out, saying, Hosanna! Blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord!

10.verse: Blessed is the kingdom that comes in the name of him who is Lord of our father David: Hosanna in the highest!

11.verse: And the Lord entered into Jerusalem and into the temple. And when he had looked round about upon everything, and now that evening time was come, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

12.verse: And on the morrow, when they had left Bethany, he hungered.

13.verse: And afar off he spotted a fig tree in leaf, and went to see whether he might find anything on it. But when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for the time of figs was not yet.

14.verse: And Jesus spoke and said to it, Never may man eat fruit from you hereafter while the world stands. And his disciples heard it.

15.verse: And they came to Jerusalem. And Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out the sellers and buyers in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money changers, and the stools of those who sold doves,

16.verse: and would not suffer anyone to carry a vessel through the temple.

17.verse: And he taught, saying to them, Is it not written: My house shall be called the house of prayer for all nations? But you have made it a den of thieves!

18.verse: And the scribes and high priests heard this, and sought how to destroy him. For they feared him, because all the people marvelled at his doctrine.

19.verse: And when evening came, he went out of the city.

20.verse: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

21.verse: And Peter remembered and said to him, Rabbi, look! The fig tree that you cursed has withered away.

22.verse: And Jesus answered and said to them, Have confidence in God.

23.verse: Truly I say to you that whoever says to this mountain, Take yourself away and cast yourself into the sea, and who does not waver in his heart, but believes that those things which he says will come to pass – whatever he says will be done for him.

24.verse: Therefore I say to you, whatever you ask when you pray, believe that you will have it, and it will be done for you.

25.verse: And when you stand and pray, forgive, if you have anything against any person, so that your Father who is in heaven may also forgive you your trespasses.

27.verse: And they came again to Jerusalem. And as he walked in the temple, there came to him the high priests and the scribes and the elders,

28.verse: and they said to him, By what authority do you do these things? And who gave you this authority, to do these things?

29.verse: Jesus answered and said to them, I will also ask of you a certain thing. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

30.verse: The baptism of John: was it from heaven, or of men? Answer me.

31.verse: They thought in themselves, saying, If we say from heaven, he will say, Why then did you not believe him?

32.verse: But if we say of men, then we fear the people. (For everyone counted John to be a very prophet.)

33.verse: And they answered and said to Jesus, We don’t know. And Jesus answered and said to them, Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.

1.verse: The vineyard is let out. Give to Caesar that which belongs to Caesar. Of the Sadducees and of the doctor of law. Hypocrites must be eschewed. The offering of the poor widow. And he began to speak to them in similitudes: A certain man planted a vineyard, and compassed it about with a hedge, and made a winepress, and built a tower in it. And he let it out on hire to husbandmen, and went into a far country.

2.verse: And when the time came, he sent a servant to the tenants, in order to receive from the tenants some of the fruit of the vineyard.

3.verse: And they caught him and beat him, and sent him back empty-handed.

4.verse: And moreover he sent to them another servant, and at him they cast stones, and wounded him in the head, and sent him back utterly reviled.

5.verse: And again he sent another, and him they killed; and many others, beating some and killing some.

6.verse: He had yet one son, whom he loved tenderly. Him also he sent to them at the last, saying, They will respect my son.

7.verse: But the tenants said amongst themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.

8.verse: And they took him and killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

9.verse: What then will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the tenants, and let out the vineyard to others.

10.verse: Have you not read this scripture: The stone which the builders refused is made the chief stone in the corner;

11.verse: this was done by the Lord, and is marvellous in our eyes?

12.verse: And they went about to apprehend him, but they feared the people. For they perceived that he had spoken that similitude against them. And they left him and went their way.

13.verse: And they sent to him certain of the Pharisees, along with Herod’s servants, to take him in his words.

14.verse: And as soon as they arrived, they said to him, Teacher, we know that you are true, and mind no man, for you do not consider the degree of men, but teach the way of God truly. Is it lawful to remit tribute to Caesar, or not?

15.verse: Ought we to give, or ought we not to give? He understood their simulation and said to them, Why do you bait me? Bring me a denarius so that I may see it.

16.verse: And they brought one. And he said to them, Whose image and superscription is this? And they said to him, Caesar’s.

17.verse: And Jesus answered and said to them, Then give to Caesar that which belongs to Caesar, and to God that which belongs to God. And they marvelled at him.

18.verse: Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him. And they asked him, saying,

19.verse: Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if any man’s brother dies and leaves his wife behind him, and leaves no children, that then his brother should take his wife and raise up seed for his brother.

20.verse: There were seven brethren. The first took a wife, and when he died left no seed behind him.

21.verse: And the second took her, and died also not leaving any seed. And the third likewise.

22.verse: And all seven had her, but left no seed behind them. Last of all, the wife died also.

23.verse: In the resurrection then, when they rise again, whose wife will she be? For seven of them had her as wife.

24.verse: Jesus answered and said to them, Are you not therefore deceived, and do not understand the scriptures, nor the power of God?

25.verse: For when they rise again from death, people neither marry nor are married, but are as the angels who are in heaven.

26.verse: And concerning the dead, that they will rise again, have you not read in the book of Moses how in the bush God spoke to him, saying, I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob?

27.verse: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. You are therefore greatly deceived.

28.verse: And there came one of the scribes who had heard them disputing together. He perceived that Jesus had answered them well, and asked him, Which is the first of all the commandments?

29.verse: Jesus answered him, The first of all the commandments is: Hear, O Israel, the Lord God is one Lord.

30.verse: And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength. This is the first commandment.

31.verse: And the second is like it: You shall love your neighbour as yourself. There is no commandment greater than these.

32.verse: And the scribe said to him, Well said, Teacher. You have spoken the truth: that there is one God, and that there is none but he.

33.verse: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the mind, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one’s neighbour as oneself, is a greater thing than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.

34.verse: And when Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, You are not far from the kingdom of God. And after that, no one dared ask him any question.

35.verse: And Jesus spoke and said, teaching in the temple, How is it the scribes say that Christ is the son of David?

36.verse: For David himself, inspired with the Holy Spirit, said, The Lord said to my Lord, sit on my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool.

37.verse: So David himself calls him Lord. By what means then is he David’s son? And the crowds of people heard him gladly.

38.verse: And he said to them in his doctrine, Beware of the scribes, who love to go about in long clothing, and love salutations in the market places,

39.verse: and the chief seats in the synagogues, and to sit in the uppermost places at feasts;

40.verse: and who devour widows’ houses, and that under a colour of long praying. These shall receive greater damnation.

41.verse: Jesus sat across from the treasury and observed how the people put money into the treasury. And many who were rich cast in much.

42.verse: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two small coins worth a pittance.

43.verse: And he called his disciples to him and said to them, Truly I say to you that this poor widow has cast in more than all the others who have cast into the treasury.

44.verse: For they all gave from their surplus, but she, in her poverty, did cast in all that she had, even all her living.

1.verse: The destruction of Jerusalem and the temple. The end of the world; the day and the hour is unknown. And as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, Teacher, see what stones and what buildings are here!

2.verse: And Jesus answered and said to him, Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left one stone upon another that will not be thrown down.

3.verse: And as he sat on the Mount of Olives across from the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,

4.verse: Tell us, when will these things be? And what will be the sign when all these things are going to be fulfilled?

5.verse: And Jesus answered them and began, saying, Take heed, lest anyone deceive you.

6.verse: For many will come in my name saying, I am Christ, and will deceive many.

7.verse: When you hear of war and reports of war, do not be troubled. For such things must be. But the end is not yet.

8.verse: For nation will arise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be earthquakes in all quarters, and famines and troubles. These are the beginning of sorrows.

9.verse: But take heed to yourselves. For they will bring you up before the councils and into the synagogues, and you will be beaten; yea, and will be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.

10.verse: And the gospel must first be preached among all nations.

11.verse: But when they lead you and present you, do not be anxious about what you will say, nor prepare ahead. But whatever is given you at that same time, that speak. For it will not be you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.

12.verse: Yea and brother will deliver brother to death, and the father the son; and the children will rise against their fathers and mothers, and will put them to death.

13.verse: And you will be hated by all men for my name’s sake. But whosoever endures to the end, the same shall be saved.

14.verse: Moreover, when you see the abomination that betokens desolation, of which Daniel the prophet has spoken, standing where it ought not, let him who reads, understand. Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

15.verse: And let him who is on the housetop not descend down into the house, neither enter in to fetch anything out of his house.

16.verse: And let him who is in the field not turn back again to those things that he left behind him, to take his clothes with him.

17.verse: Woe shall be then to women that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days.

18.verse: But pray that your flight be not in the winter.

19.verse: For there shall be in those days such tribulation as was not from the beginning of creatures that God created to this time, nor will be again.

20.verse: And if the Lord did not shorten those days, no one would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, whom he has chosen, he has shortened those days.

21.verse: And then if anyone says to you, Lo, here is Christ! Lo, he is there! – believe it not.

22.verse: For false Christs will arise, and false prophets, and they will show miracles and wonders, to deceive if it were possible even the elect.

23.verse: But take heed: behold, I have told you all things beforehand.

24.verse: Moreover in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will grow dark, and the moon will not give her light,

25.verse: and the stars of heaven will fall; and the powers which are in heaven shall move.

26.verse: And then will they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

27.verse: And then he will send his angels, and will gather together his elect from the four winds, and from one end of the world to the other.

28.verse: Learn from a similitude of the fig tree. When its branches are yet tender and it has brought forth leaves, you know that summer is near.

29.verse: So also in like manner, when you see these things come to pass, understand that it is near, even at the doors.

30.verse: Truly I say to you that this generation will not pass till all these things be done.

31.verse: Heaven and earth shall pass, but my words will not pass.

32.verse: But of that day and hour no one knows, no, not the angels who are in heaven, nor the Son himself, but the Father only.

33.verse: Take heed. Watch and pray, for you know not when the time is.

34.verse: It is as a man who has gone into a far country, and has left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each his work, and instructed the porter to watch.

35.verse: Watch therefore. For you know not when the master of the house will come – whether at evening or midnight, whether at the cock-crowing or in the dawning –

36.verse: lest, if he come suddenly, he should find you sleeping.

37.verse: And what I say to you, I say to all: Watch!

1.verse: Mary Magdalene anoints Christ. The Passover lamb is eaten. Christ is taken. Peter denies him, with many other things that were demanded of Christ. After two days followed Passover, and the days of sweet bread. And the high priests and the scribes were seeking means to apprehend Jesus by craft and put him to death.

2.verse: But, they said, not in the feast day, lest any uproar arise among the people.

3.verse: When he was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, even as he sat at food, there came a woman having an alabaster jar of anointing oil called nard, which was pure and costly. And she broke the jar and poured it on his head.

4.verse: And there were some who were displeased in themselves and said, Why this waste of oyntment?

5.verse: For it could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii, and the money given to the poor. And they grudged against her.

6.verse: And Jesus said, Let her be in rest. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work on me.

7.verse: For you will have the poor with you always, and whenever you wish, you may do them good. But me you will not have always.

8.verse: She has done what she could: she came beforehand to anoint my body for the burial.

9.verse: Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached throughout the whole world, this also that she has done will be told, in remembrance of her.

10.verse: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went away to the high priests, to betray him to them.

11.verse: When they heard that, they were glad, and promised that they would give him money. And he sought an opportune way to betray him.

12.verse: And the first day of sweet bread, when people offer the Passover lamb, Jesus’ disciples said to him, Where would you like us to go and prepare for you to eat the Passover lamb?

13.verse: And he sent forth two of his disciples and said to them, Go into the city, and there a man will meet you bearing a pitcher of water. Follow him.

14.verse: And wherever he goes in, say to the head of the house, The Teacher asks, Where is the guest chamber where I may eat the Passover lamb with my disciples?

15.verse: And he will show you a large upper room furnished and prepared: there make ready for us.

16.verse: And his disciples went forth, and came to the city, and found things as he had said to them, and made ready the Passover lamb.

17.verse: And in the evening, he came with the twelve.

18.verse: And as they sat at the table and ate, Jesus said, Truly I say to you that one of you who eats with me will betray me.

19.verse: And they began to mourn, and to say to him one by one, Is it I? And another said, Is it I?

20.verse: He answered and said to them, It is one of the twelve, and the same dips with me in the platter.

21.verse: The Son of man goes as it is written of him. But woe is to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed. It would have been good for that man if he had never been born.

22.verse: And as they ate, Jesus took bread, blessed, and broke, and gave to them and said, Take, eat; this is my body.

23.verse: And he took the cup, gave thanks, and gave it to them, and they all drank of it.

24.verse: And he said to them, This is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.

25.verse: Truly I say to you, I will drink no more of this fruit of the vine until that day that I drink it new in the kingdom of God.

26.verse: And when they had sung praises, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

27.verse: And Jesus said to them, All of you will fall away because of me this night. For it is written: I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.

28.verse: But after I am risen up again, I will go into Galilee ahead of you.

29.verse: But Peter said to him, Even if all were to fall away, yet I would not.

30.verse: And Jesus said to him, Truly I say to you, this day – even this night, before the cock crows twice – you will deny me three times.

31.verse: And Peter spoke more boldly: No; if I must die with you, I will not deny you. Likewise also said all the others.

32.verse: And they came to a place named Gethsemane. And he said to his disciples, Sit here, while I go apart and pray.

33.verse: And he took with him Peter, James, and John. And he began to be horrified, and to be in an agony,

34.verse: and said to them, My soul is very heavy, even to the death. You stay here and watch.

35.verse: And he went forward a little, and fell down on the ground and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.

36.verse: And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible to you; take away this cup from me. Nevertheless, not what I will, but what you will, be done.

37.verse: And he came and found them sleeping and said to Peter, Simon, are you sleeping? Could not you watch with me one hour?

38.verse: Watch and pray, lest you enter into temptation. The spirit is ready, but the flesh is weak.

39.verse: And again he went away and prayed, and spoke the same words.

40.verse: And he returned and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy; neither did they know what to answer him.

41.verse: And he came the third time, and said to them, Sleep on now, and take your ease! It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of man will be delivered into the hands of sinners.

42.verse: Rise up, let us go. Lo, he who betrays me is at hand.

43.verse: And immediately, while he yet spoke, came Judas, one of the twelve. With him was a large band of people with swords and clubs, sent from the high priests and scribes and elders.

44.verse: And he who betrayed him had arranged a sign, saying, Whomever I kiss, he it is; take him and lead him away warily.

45.verse: And as soon as Judas had come, he went straightaway to Jesus and said to him, Master, Master! and kissed him.

46.verse: And they laid their hands on him and took him.

47.verse: And one of those who stood by drew out a sword and struck a servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.

48.verse: And Jesus spoke and said to them, You have come out as if to a thief, with swords and with clubs to capture me.

49.verse: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you did not take me. But the scriptures must be fulfilled.

50.verse: And they all forsook him, and ran away.

51.verse: And he had a follower, a certain young man clothed in linen upon the bare. And the young men caught him,

52.verse: but he left his linen cloth and fled from them naked.

53.verse: And they led Jesus away to the highest priest of all, and to him came all the high priests and the elders and the scribes.

54.verse: And Peter followed him a great way off, right into the palace courtyard of the high priest, and sat with the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.

55.verse: And the high priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus, to put him to death, and found none.

56.verse: Yet many bore false witness against him, but their testimonies did not agree together.

57.verse: And certain men arose and brought false witness against him, saying,

58.verse: We heard him say, I will destroy this temple made with hands, and within three days I will build another made without hands.

59.verse: But their testimonies did not agree together.

60.verse: And the highest priest stood up amongst them and asked Jesus, saying, Do you answer nothing? How is it that these men bear witness against you?

61.verse: And he held his peace and answered nothing. Again the highest priest asked him and said to him, Are you Christ, the Son of the Blessed?

62.verse: And Jesus said, I am; and you will see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power and coming in the clouds of heaven.

63.verse: Then the highest priest tore his clothes and said, Why do we need any further witnesses?

64.verse: You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think? And they all gave sentence that he was worthy of death.

65.verse: And some began to spit at him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to say to him, Prophesy to us! And the servants struck him on the face.

66.verse: And as Peter was below in the interior courtyard, there came one of the servant girls of the highest priest.

67.verse: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked on him and said, Were you not also with Jesus of Nazareth?

68.verse: And he denied it, saying, I do not know him, or understand what you are saying. And he went out into the porch, and the cock crew.

69.verse: And a maidservant saw him and again began to say to those who stood by, This is one of them.

70.verse: And he denied it again. And soon after, those standing by said again to Peter, Surely you are one of them, for you are from Galilee and your speech is the same.

71.verse: And he began to curse and to swear, saying, I do not know this man of whom you speak.

72.verse: And again the cock crew. And Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said to him – before the cock crows twice, you will deny me three times – and he began to weep.

1.verse: The passion of Christ. Of his death and burial. And early in the dawning, the high priests consulted with the elders and the scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus and led him away, and delivered him to Pilate.

2.verse: And Pilate asked him, Are you the king of the Jews? And he answered and said to him, It is as you say.

3.verse: And the high priests accused him of many things.

4.verse: So Pilate asked him again, saying, Do you answer nothing? Look how many things they lay to your charge.

5.verse: But Jesus still answered never a word, so that Pilate marvelled.
